Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Counter

  • public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class allows you to easily set a starting int and count up or down from it and up to a maximum.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Counter()
      The constuctor doesn't take any arguments, values of count and max can be set using the setMax() and setCount() methods.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrease()
      This will decrement the value of count by 1, unless count is already 0, in which case it remains the same.
      void decrease(int n)
      This will decrement the value of count by the specified amount.
      int getCount()
      This method returns the value of count.
      int getMax()
      This method returns the value of max.
      void increase()
      This will increment the value of count by 1, unless count has already reached the max, in which case it resets to 0.
      void increase(int n)
      This will increment the value of count by a specified amount.
      void reset()
      This will reset the value of count to 0, and print a confirmation.
      void setCount(int n)
      This method sets the value of count to whatever parameter you pass.
      void setMax(int n)
      This method sets the value of max to whatever parameter you pass.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns as a string the current values of count and max.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • Counter

        public Counter()
        The constuctor doesn't take any arguments, values of count and max can be set using the setMax() and setCount() methods.

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        This method returns the value of count.

      • getMax

        public int getMax()
        This method returns the value of max.

      • setCount

        public void setCount(int n)
        This method sets the value of count to whatever parameter you pass.

        n - The value-to-be of count.

      • setMax

        public void setMax(int n)
        This method sets the value of max to whatever parameter you pass.
        Parameters:
        n - The value-to-be of max.

      • increase

        public void increase()
        This will increment the value of count by 1, unless count has already reached the max, in which case it resets to 0.

      • increase

        public void increase(int n)
        This will increment the value of count by a specified amount.
        Parameters:
        n - The value to increment by.

      • decrease

        public void decrease()
        This will decrement the value of count by 1, unless count is already 0, in which case it remains the same.

      • decrease

        public void decrease(int n)
        This will decrement the value of count by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        n - The value to decrement by.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This will reset the value of count to 0, and print a confirmation.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns as a string the current values of count and max.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
